name: overlaboured
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Something that is overlaboured tries too hard to be good, interesting, etc. : The metaphor of love's game never sounds overlaboured. The menu sounds a little over-laboured, a little too complicated, and lacking in foods we have heard of.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has a slightly overlaboured style of writing which sounds both too mannered and too transparent.Her clothes are always elaborate, but never overlaboured. Although in some places a little obscure and overlaboured, the descriptive passages are soft and beautiful .
